review.reviewBody: Love my boots. Wish the toes were rounded though. Very comfortable and supportive. The high support level hooked me. I am a chef and was so impressed how my feet did not feel tired at the end of 14 hour shifts. I also feel in control when I walk down my Brooklyn Streets. 😄 Thank you Ariat.
review.name: Support level on 🔥

review.reviewBody: These run way bigger than listed meaning Ive had to order three pairs to try and get the right size. I am a 39 and have had to go via 6 -.5.5 and now 5. The smallest of them just about fits but they slip off my heels a little and they are too wide at the top.  I tried really hard with these boots but Ive given up now.
review.name: Look the part but disappointing
comment: Here at Ariat Europe customer feedback is very important to us. Thank you for your honest review. We appreciate the time you have taken to raise this with us, please be assured your comments have been recognised.

review.reviewBody: Hello, It took me a bit to decide on which boot  style to buy,  I am a ten and when I received my boots I was so excited. I wear a 10B.Unfortunately the boots are too big after a month they have stretched and when I walk heel toe the boots slam into my toes. Also, they are heavy and it painful.  i and back to my old boots…savannah chocolate
review.name: Fit
comment: Thank you for your feedback on these boots. We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. Look out for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

review.reviewBody: These boots are super cute.  And they are very comfortable and require no break in.  I really really really wanted to love them but…. I wear a size 8 and they made my feet look much bigger than normal.  I couldn’t get past that.  The toe box was perfect but my heel was flopping up and down as I walked.  That was as the deal breaker for me.  I sadly sent them back
review.name: So cute but just not right for me

review.reviewBody: I didn’t love the fit. I wanted a boot I could walk Al day in. These were not that boot
review.name: Disappointed
comment: We’re sorry to hear we didn’t stack up! We’d really appreciate a chance to connect with you in a more meaningful way on how we can improve. Please email info@ariat.com with additional details on your experience so that we can better assist you.

review.reviewBody: I’m writing my review in case your feet are shaped like mine. I wear a 9 but order a 10 in boots. I had to send the first pair back because they were tight in the toe. I didn’t realize the popular almond shape toe would require me to go up a size and a half and I still can’t wear heavy socks. I have a high instep and high arch, long toes and used to buy wide all the time but had not had to do that in years. I had to add my insole,  couldn’t feel any arch support without it. I could use a wide in these. I’m wearing them in house everyday and they’re giving a little. This is a heavy duty boot and I’m keeping them because they’re attractive, well made and should last a long time.
review.name: Had to go up 1.5 size to accommodate my foot shape

review.reviewBody: These boots are extremely comfortable and give me the walking support I need when walking the cobblestone streets of ancient cities …
review.name: Excellent style, quality and comfort … !

review.reviewBody: Love the look, color was a little off… much brighter brown then expected. I am going to have to get insoles for them other wise they fit perfect.
review.name: Love look, color is right

review.reviewBody: Some concerns with thin soles needing to be replaced too soon.
review.name: Soles too thin

review.reviewBody:
I've worn these boots for over 2 years now while working long shifts on my feet and they are so comfortable. 
I work in sales and needed something that looked nice but could also hold up to the other sides of my work that required a lot of flexibility,  comfort, and resistance to scuffs and liquids since im so often on the ground in wet and sticky environments. 
These are sturdy and durable, and keep my feet dry in the very wet state I live in.
review.name: Perfect. Stylish yet functional

name: Savannah Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Mountain Hardwear Wander Pass Hat, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase! This hat has quickly become one of my go-to accessories for outdoor adventures and everyday wear.

First and foremost, the quality of this hat is outstanding. The materials used are durable and feel like they can withstand some serious wear and tear. I appreciate that Mountain Hardwear has created a product that's not only stylish but built to last.

The design of the Wander Pass Hat is both functional and fashionable. It's got a classic, timeless look that pairs well with a variety of outfits. The neutral color options make it versatile for different occasions, whether I'm hitting the trails or simply running errands around town.

Comfort-wise, the Wander Pass Hat doesn't disappoint. It fits snugly but not too tight, and the adjustable strap at the back ensures a customized fit. The moisture-wicking sweatband is a game-changer for hot and humid days, keeping me cool and dry.

Overall, I highly recommend the Mountain Hardwear Wander Pass Hat to anyone in need of a reliable and stylish headwear option. It's a fantastic blend of form and function, and I can't imagine my outdoor adventures without it. Kudos to Mountain Hardwear for delivering a top-notch product!
review.name: Perfect Logo Hat!

review.reviewBody: The hat is great. Issue I had was that I bought two, and the black one was noticably much smaller
review.name: Sizing not consistent

name: Wander Pass Hat

review.reviewBody: I looove Hokas so much ! I have achilles tendon and Hokas are the only pair of shoes that don't hurt my feet at all! They never disappoint, not sure what happened to this model but it literally triggers my achilles tendon right away not sure why! I returned them immediately. Also they do run small so I would size up. I'm always a size 9 I had to get a 9 1/2 for this particular pair
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I loved the Rincon 3 so much but couldn't find them when I wanted another pair. Tried these but they are nothing like what I love about the Rincon 3. I have 3 pairs of the Rincon 3 and am just hoping that they will bring back the 3 before I wear these out, because I will definitely not be buying the 4 again.
review.name: So sad. The previous version was amazing! These are no good

review.reviewBody: I was hoping these would be very similar to my Rincon 3. They've changed so much from the 3. The back of the shoe is different which causes the shoe to rub and cause blisters on my heel. My feet were hurting after the first day and I never had that problem with my Rincon 3s. Hoping they come back with the 3s. I ended up returning these
review.name: Nothing like the Rincon 3

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a big miss. I'm a loyal Hoka owner and always loved their selection of wides and that they truly are wide shoes with ample room in the toe box which is not easy to come by. I LOVED my rincon 3s and they helped me heal my plantar fasciitis and get back on my feet after a calf surgery... but the soles always wore faster than expected. So I was excited to hear that Hoka "fixed" and "improved" the sole with the Rincon 4. I've waiting just under two months to write this review so I could really test out the rincon 4 and here is my take: -the sole is stiffer and firmer in feel BUT still wore out way faster than expected (or it should) The sole is almost shot after almost two months of moderate wear. -narrower and smaller than the previous version. Sized up a half size for the Rincon 4 and the width is still only OK. -not nearly as comfortable is prior version. -the tongue is just awkward and gets in the way when lacing up the shoe. I switched from the Bondi to the Rincon after the Bondi disappointed and now the Rincon disappoints too. It feels like I am starting to detect a theme with Hoka which is too bad because they really are the best wide running shoe provider.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I loved my Rincon 3s. Bought Rincon 4 and it's a totally different shoe and not in a good way! Not as flexible as the 3 and the toe box feels tight as does the fit in general. Why did you change the style? Why are there no non slip patterns on the sole as with the 3? Why did you remove the pull tab to help get the shoe on. Overall I think it's cheaply made. Please go back to Rincon 3 style and features!
review.name: Would NOT buy again!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is not comfortable it hurt my feet so bad. I would return them but I already wore them twice thinking they needed to be broken in, not the case. The shoe seems very short like not enough room in the toe box. I ordered 8 1/2 wide. Not comfortable at all. Very expensive to not be able to wear.
review.name: Not what I expected!

review.reviewBody: I have many pairs of Rincon 3 and the new version runs smaller. Very frustrating!!!! Shoes feels great except need to size up half of a size.
review.name: Made new version smaller

review.reviewBody: I will never buy and thing else but hoka. I've broke both my ankles so I've had a hard time with shoes. And these are amazing
review.name: Yes i wluld

review.reviewBody: These are my everyday shoes and I was so happy when I was able to find them again. Pure comfort.
review.name: I love these shoes

review.reviewBody: I've run in Hokas for three years now, always in the Rincon. (I run 5-7 days a week, usually on the road, and 3-10 miles at a time.) Rincon 3s were maybe my favorite running shoes ever. While my Hokas always cost more and wear out faster than my Brooks, the comfort seemed to make them worth it. As you can imagine, I'm really disappointed to report that the Rincon 4s, which I've run in a total of FOUR times in the past week will be the part pair of Hokas that I will buy. In general, the shoe just feels generally worse with weird design choices. I don't understand the decision to put padding in the tongue and the lacing system seems to have been slightly alerted so that there's now a gap that bunches up on the outside of my foot (NEVER had that issue before). The locker, however, is the bottom of the shoe. The tread is already much smoother and slicker - I can't imagine running on damp asphalt in these - and in just FOUR runs, what little tread there is is already rubbing off to become just smooth, slippery foam. It's ridiculous to pay over $100 for a pair of running shoes and to have them degrade this fast. I'll be lucky if I make them last three months. Honestly there is better quality abs design to be had elsewhere. I read the other reviews complaining that the Rincon 4s aren't great but I trusted in Hokas in general to assume those flaws must be exaggerated. I never write reviews but came in here just to help others avoid this same mistake. The Rincon 4s aren't worth it, even if you get them on sale. I loved Hokas when i first bought them... but now it's time to look elsewhere for a show that's going to make my daily runs with me.
review.name: First time disappointed by a Rincon...

name: Rincon 4 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: These pads have all of the features you can ask for and blend the line of a trail and dh pad. I guess some people might call that enduro?! They're comfortable to pedal in, but offer more protection than a sleeve pad. Would still consider them lightweight and breathable. THE ZIPPER IS SO CLUTCH. Being able to put your pads on or pull them off with your shoes on comes in handy a lot more than you'd think. They might fit a little bit big, but I also have pretty skinny quads and calves, so I went for the small and after a few rides they stretched just to where I need them. Worth the money and on the money!
review.name: On the Money

name: K-Traze AMP Zip Knee Pad

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Ample cushioning. No fear of hurting soles of my feet. Easy on off. Wearing alone and at times with socks, depending on weather. Lightweight. Easy kicks.

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for camping, lightweight, great for using in the water and around camp. These are so versatile that I've used these for everyday errands as well, even sometimes a slippers. These are very easy to clean also. Main drawback I found is when camping (campsites were located on the beach) the sand and small pebbles collect in the shoe, which can be annoying.

review.reviewBody: The soles feel wonderful walking on gravel. Their first trip out of the box was to a mineral spa in New Mexico.  While everyone else was slip-sliding in wet feet, it was full steam ahead for these. The heel is cushy-soft and I wear them every day working in the yard.

review.reviewBody:
When backpacking I normally don't use a pack cover - just put anything I care about (clothes, sleep system) in dry bags. 

I got this for gun hunting season for safety, and it works really well.
review.name: The orange is great for gun season

review.reviewBody: Simple, but effective!  The built in pouch for the rain fly is a nice touch.
review.name: A must have!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a terraframe 80 that I took camping for a few days in heavy rain. Worked great and I appreciate the loop used to secure it to the bag. I really believe these bags (since they’re so expensive) should come with a rain fly. I’m not too poo butt since the rain fly wasn’t crazy expensive to buy after the fact.
review.name: Works as expected

review.reviewBody:
This cover is sturdy and the band that holds it in place well and didn’t stretch out over almost three weeks of daily use stretched to its limit. 

However the sizing is off for the Radix packs -putting things in the side pockets of the Radix 57 meant the medium didn’t fit as well as I would have liked. It left the side pockets slightly exposed. Size up or try another brand for those MR packs.
review.name: Doesn’t fit all MR packs the same

review.reviewBody: The second one I've owned. This was purchased for my son and his Scouting adventures! Great product but can't control a teenager's forgetfulness in misplacing stuff so bought a new one because the last one was great!
review.name: Simple and Effective

review.reviewBody: It is a pack fly and does it's job.  No special powers, or bells/whistles.  It is light weight, fits by Radix well, stows away nicely, and meets my expectations.  Great product.
review.name: It's a pack fly`

review.reviewBody: Great quality!! This is one of those items that you’re happy to have it when you need it.
review.name: It’s exactly what I needed.

review.reviewBody: The Small Pack Fly is excellent. Durable, well made and fits my Catalyst 26 perfectly.
review.name: Very happy

review.reviewBody: Bought to cover my Radix 57. Fits great with room for fly rod case and wet shoes. Safety orange color is a plus.
review.name: A great Radix Fit

review.reviewBody: Honestly, I've never used it yet but I did put it over my Bridger 35 and it fit.  It's a rain cover. My biggest complaint is that it's a pain when trying to fold it back to store it.  Like another viewer said, it's best to have it or something similar in case you get caught out in some adverse weather conditions.
review.name: It's a pack fly

name: Pack Fly

review.reviewBody: Sims has awesome shoes for saltwater wading on the texas flats for redfish and trout with or without waders.  They are very comfortable and the high quality.
review.name: Flats wading shoe

review.reviewBody: My first pair of Simms flats sneakers I bought in 2002. I loved them. They lasted me over twenty years and the only reason I bought these new ones were the foam around the ankles wore out. The soles were still great. If not for the ankles I’d still be using them. So… got these and I do like but. After about the first year the soles started to peal on the back and sides. I’ve been crazy glueing  them back as they peal. Very sturdy boot itself and nice and light but soles coming off is very disappointing. Anyway just checking in to let you know that could be addressed.  Been a Simms guy all my life and this is probably my only complaint.
review.name: Not like they use to be.

review.reviewBody:
Too big!  Wish you made a woman’s smaller size! 

Returned them!
review.name: Nice looking but big!

review.reviewBody: These flats shoes rock!  They keep sand out and stand up to everything from sand, to skiffs, to razor sharp coral.
review.name: Amazing support

review.reviewBody: Great boot! Materials feel durable the soles have very good traction and very comfortable!

First impressions when I received these were positive: good fit, felt comfortable, good support, durable construction. Impressions after wearing them for 8 days on North Andros are not so positive. 
1. The footbed is quite hard and unforgiving.
2. Seems like they were built for people who don't log lots of miles while spending their time on firm, pristine sand flats. I logged probably 5-6 miles a day slowly working many, many acres of flats over 6 to 8 hours. The flats ranged from nice and firm to soft with many dips and holes. By the end of each day my feet HURT! In fact, I've never had my feet hurt so badly from shoes.
3. They seem overbuilt, too stiff and heavy for these kinds of applications. Again, if you're just cruising around perfectly hard flats for a couple hours, they're fine.
4. The sole could use a little more built-in traction. One day I walked a degraded coral shoreline to get to some flats. The rock was covered with a thin film of muck and these boots skated crazily on it and I almost wiped out. And this was not a spot it would be easy to get help if hurt.
5. It would be nice if the build was more like a light hiking shoe with more cushion, better flexibility and better traction. A more athletic build for people who move and cover a lot of ground.
Would return them if I could.
review.name: I really wanted to love these.

review.reviewBody: So far I’ve used it wading off the beaches in Belize and have had no issues with them. They are comfy and sturdy. The arches are slightly high if you have flat feet like mine but I quickly got use to them. I also went a half size up to pair them with the Fly weight wading socks.
review.name: Perfect with the Fly weight wading socks

review.reviewBody:
First trip in my Simms Flats Sneakers was on a weeklong bonefishing trip to Mars Bay on South Andros.  I normally wear a shoe size of 7.5-8 wide, but went with size 9 on the Flats Sneakers with the neoprene socks.  Fit was great.  We waded some pretty significant distances on a couple of days, and the Sneakers were very comfortable.  Glad I got them, and I’d certainly recommend them highly.

Caught some nice fish too.  I figure it was the Sneakers.  Why not!
review.name: First class!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable wading sneakers with arch support, I can wear these all day without my feet hurting.

perfect for coastal Texas wading opportunities.
light yet functional
review.name: A great addition for coastal Texas wading opportunities

name: Flats Sneaker - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet to replace my current aging helmet.  I was disappointed to see the “new” helmet is almost 3 years old. This is being returned.
review.name: Received Dec 24. Manufactured 2/2022.
comment: Thank you for your feedback! We’re sorry the helmet didn’t meet your expectations. We’ve reached out to you directly to assist with this.

review.reviewBody: On my third  one, switched from black to white,  and crashed once. Fits perfect, size small. I love that it holds the sunglasses!
review.name: Airy and light

review.reviewBody: After less than 3 years of kind use (wash periodically with gentle soap, transport in soft cloth bag, etc), the fit system on the back of my Synthe helmet has snapped.  Also, the finish is a combination of gloss and mat, but the mat finish is peeling, I suppose from sun exposure, which is a little ridiculous, given that my head is almost always in the sun when riding...
review.name: Disappointed...

name: Synthe Mips II Helmet

description: Buy the Mountain House Granola with Milk & Blueberries online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Granola with Milk & Blueberries
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Granola with Milk & Blueberries online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've ordered this for several to-go bags and use it during camping and hunting season.  I have never been disappointed with the quality and taste.
review.name: Always Good!

review.reviewBody:
We have this in the Army. It is so good when I found out where it came from.
I ordered a bunch of it now i'm ordering number ten cans.
review.name: Delicious,  so easy. Add cold water. That's it!

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd time ordering Granola with Milk and Blueberries.  It is a great grab and go breakfast for camping or while on the road.  Depending on the desired texture,  you can let it soak longer or shorter.  Good balance of fruit and granola and the milk reconstitutes very well-no lumps!
review.name: Simple and Tasty

review.reviewBody: Awesome products! Avid backpacker and also just like to be prepared.
review.name: buildinganark

review.reviewBody: This granola berries taste so good. I find myself getting into my stash.lol That's why I purchased quanity.
review.name: Tastes great!

review.reviewBody: I enjoyed this for breakfast 3 days. Add a little hot water and you have a tummy warming meal.
review.name: Quick and easy

review.reviewBody: My husband and I originally tried Mountain House’s granola a few months ago and now we crave it! It’s so good!!
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody: Pros:  I had them stored away in case of emergency but, couldn't resist the smell of the blueberries through the package.  And, the flavor combination is wonderful.  Freeze dried but, fresh.  Very tasty and easy on the stomach; no after effects.  I would eat this all of the time.  Con:  Be aware of the sharp edges after opening the package.  If possible, eat out of a bowl or cup.
review.name: A Delicious Flavor Combination

review.reviewBody: Great snack and easy to make probably the closest to kosher item on their website.. would love to see a certified kosher menu made definitely would boost their client reach. Overall great item! Love that it’s guaranteed for storage up to 30+ years!
review.name: Wish they had certified Kosher options!

review.reviewBody: Used the Granola with milk and blueberries to start the day during a weeklong backpack trip in the Mummy Range of Colorado.   Jetboil hot water for coffee and granola for  nice kick start  before heading up the peaks..  People told me the granola is also good cold, but its tough to beat when it's hot.  Quick and tasty energy.  Thank You!
review.name: Quick Start

name: Granola with Milk & Blueberries

hasVariant.name: Alpine Plate
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine Plate online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my child 14 years ago. She is now a teenager and these bowls and plates are just like brand new. No dents or scratches and they've been used almost daily by our family over the last 14 years. Amazing quality! Five stars plus!!!
review.name: 14 years later still as good as new

review.reviewBody: Same as the bowls, I keep a few extras of these in my kitchen as they also make great plates for everyday use. The sticker/label that it comes with leaves behind a residue that takes a couple washes in the dishwasher to remove, but I would still repurchase as they're very practical.
review.name: Same as the bowls, I

review.reviewBody: What can I say? I only buy these when I lose one or I need more place settings. I have some that are 25 yrs old. They aren’t deep, but they’re fantastic plates that fit MSR kits. They’ve survived kids, dogs, frisbee tosses and you can actually cut meat on them …. Perfect in my opinion
review.name: Alpine™ Plate

review.reviewBody: Great plate. It gets regular use inside my home when not camping.
review.name: Not just for camping either

review.reviewBody: I purchased 4 plates and I cannot get the residue label adhesive off. I have tried dish soap, scrubbing, rubbing with olive oil. There is still adhesive residue. I haven't been able to try the plates :/
review.name: Label adhesive residue won't come off

review.reviewBody:
These are part of my car-camping and white-water kits. They are solid, light, plain, simple, effective, adjective, adjective, etc.

I am a gear-hound that seeks out the new items that matter as materials improve but see no reason that I'll be trading these in anytime soon.
review.name: What More Do You Need?

review.reviewBody: Not for the gram counter, this is expedition quality for base camping, expedition canoeing, and car camping. They pair perfectly with the Alpine 4 Pot Set!!!
review.name: Heavy duty and hard core!!!

review.reviewBody: Light weight, tough, and exactly what I was looking for. Cleans up easy, and strong enough to cut food on as well as stuff in my pack without worries of it breaking. Will be getting a few more!
review.name: Love this plate

review.reviewBody: Great plates! I wish they were a little bigger but they're very light weight and hold up well.
review.name: Perfect for camping for backpacking!

review.reviewBody: All is in the title ! The design is simple but the plate is very resistant (it still looks brand new after several uses), and has the perfect volume so that we can take it everywhere and we only have to fill it once during a meal !
review.name: Simple but Efficient

name: Alpine Plate

description: Buy the Fox Racing Launch D3O Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Launch D3O Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Launch D3O Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Launch D3O Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Launch D3O Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Launch D3O Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Launch D3O Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good fit with boots and shorter legs. Did not want my knee pads to encroach too far into my boots. These are perfect. They come just to the top of my boots.
review.name: Good fit with boots.

review.reviewBody: As far as comfort goes for a bulkier pad, these puppies rock (barely notice them, even on the uphill climbs), and I love black or grey gear (a little hard to come by in women?s specific stuff)! The biggest thing I ran into was at the beginning of this year?s season, the fit was solid, but by a few weeks ago, the strap isn?t as tight,  and I have no more room to go as far as the Velcro strap is concerned (and I am at the very edge). I took a gamble on these because I am barely at the minimum measurement requirements for the Small, and I worried about natural stretching with use, so it?s not really the item?s fault. Would love if Fox made an XS; I really love their products! Until then, I think I am going to try the Dakine Slayer pads as the sizing has a wider range. However, as long as you meet or slightly exceed the measurement requirements, these are amazing pads!
review.name: Fit: great turned not so great.

review.reviewBody:
I initially LOVED these knee pads. Lots of protection, great comfort while pedaling, and quite breathable. 

However, After just about 4 months of not so frequent use (Winter season) the backs of the pads are already shredded and falling apart. For $80 I expected a more durable product. 

Would NOT recommend unless you are prepared to replace them every season.
review.name: Wear out quickly

review.reviewBody: Like the Ranger short from Fox I keep coming back to the launch knee pad when it comes time to buy new knee pads every other year or so.  They fit and protect fairly well and feel nice.  I generally use these for shuttling or riding chairlifts so I?m not sure how well they would do as a pedaling knee pad but for my purposes they work great. Would recommend.
review.name: Keep coming back to these knee pads

name: Launch D3O Knee Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the ROAM Adventure Co 7-Gallon Water Tank online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The factory shutoff, hose, and side clips to secure the hose are trash. The side clips used to secure the hose are made of cheap plastic and rubber, they all broke off after only a few uses. The hose is very short and cheap, I just threw it away and bought a 25ft marine rated hose. Also the factory water shutoff leaks and the quick release system is annoying and no good, got rid of that too. After buying all my own replacement parts it works how it should’ve in the first place. Roam needs to manufacture better quality items for the price they are charging. Overall annoyed and disappointed.
review.name: Does the job but components are trash

name: 7-Gallon Water Tank

review.reviewBody: Good modern shape, drops stay up high, which is nice when you are using your brakes in rough terrain.  I was unable to run a wire Internally from one end to the other. review.reviewBody: I got these for ice climbing and cross-country skiing, and I really love them. They are very comfortable, my feet stayed pretty warm, and the lock laces work great for keeping less tension in the toes and tighter on the ankles. I wore them for a full day right out of the box and had no issues needing to break them in. The additional tongue insert is a great feature, too. I have narrow feet and without the extra tongue I really had to pull the laces in a lot which made for some lumpy spots, but with the added tongue, they fit perfect.
review.name: Great boot!

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've owned multiple pairs of Nepal Cubes simply because they are the only women's mountaineering boot on the market. It is still difficult to fine my right size (37.5), so I ended up with a pair of 38s (after slipping around in 39s for 2 years and losing multiple toenails to a 37). Overall the boot works and is durable, as I've been using my current pair for the last 4 years. My biggest gripe is that no matter what modifications I make, I can't seem to get it so my heel isn't sliding around and popping out every time I use my front points. I wish they had a double version of this boot with a boa system so I could make sure my shoelaces stay tight through the whole climb. I also wish they were warmer, as my feet inevitably go numb every time I'm out. At the end of the day, I guess I should be thankful there is one women's option, but this is a pretty basic boot and doesn't offer as much warmth or security as I want.
review.name: Heel popping goodness

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots for a summer job as an ice climbing guide on a glacier in Alaska, and they never failed to impress me. I never worried about the waterproofing failing, and the full shank design with heel and toe bail worked well with any pair of crampons for an excellent climbing experience. I would choose a lighter shoe for extended glacier trekking, but for climbing, these win!
review.name: Excellent Ice Climbing Boot

Yup, wearing my Darn Tough  socks is my way of bragging about being a Yankee from northern New England!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love them. They feel good. Make me look good. I rock them in the outfit.
review.name: Fire boots

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are so cute and comfy! They did not feel like they needed to be broken in and were comfy from the get go. Did not rub against my heel at all and were great to walk in. These are a perfect fall boot and will fit into any wardrobe. They were also true to size.
review.name: Cute and comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't tell you how many compliments I've gotten with these boots on. These pair with any outfit really well and they are ultra comfortable! I highly recommend these boots for any season of the year!
review.name: So Sylish!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free as part of a promotion. I have been wearing these boots around for a couple of weeks now and they are so cute and stylish. I love the lug sole and the material is definitely high quality. They look great with jeans and are a style I can easily wear for work or more casual wear. The boots are very comfortable, lightweight and easy to walk in unlike some other platform boots. One thing I would note is the boots run a little narrow so you may want to size up if you have a wide foot. Overall these are a great boot for fall!
review.name: Cute fall boots!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The weather has gotten cooler and these boots have been the perfect addition to my fall outfits! They are comfortable and go with so much. They are also durable and I am looking forward to continuing to wear them through the winter season!
review.name: Comfy and cute!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was gifted by Timberland in exchange for my honest review. Guys, this is it! It's the perfect everyday boots during the colder months. Fits true to size and is very comfortable. I walked all around Soho to put it to test and my feet didn't hurt after. The quality and craftsmanship is definitely unmatched (Pro tip: choose half size bigger if you plan on wearing thicker socks)
review.name: Sturdy boots!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These Chelsea boots from Timberland are so stylish and so cute! I absolutely love how comfortable these are. They don't feel heavy on your feet and they're super comfortable! They're strong and they are very durable. These are gonna last you for a long time. I love how they don't stain when getting wet. Compared to other boots these are gonna last and they're more comfortable. I'm obsessed with these boots. I will be wearing these every day.!
review.name: Must HAVE for Winter!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this product as a free sample from BuzzAgent. I love these shoes. The light color worried me a little initially, but they are so easy to keep clean. They're so comfortable and so cute. The style is so nice and the quality is amazing. The stitching and overlaying of fabrics is seamless. Usually, my feet kill me after walking around for awhile but I've not had that issue with these shoes. Amazing shoes and I've recommend them to all who will listen!
review.name: I love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I liked the boots! I think that the only thing i am not a huge fan of is the thick sole at the bottom. Not that it is uncomfortable but it is not aesthetically my favorite thing. I got these boots for free in exchange for writing a review and sharing my thoughts
review.name: I like the boots!

review.itemreviewed: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received these boots as complimentary from BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review. I have always loved the Timberland brand and was lucky to receive these boots for free. I absolutely love these boots as they are very stylish, comfortable for all day walks and also good for outdoor hiking. I have been wearing these shoes for almost 2 weeks daily and have no issues with them. I would definitely recommend these boots. I love the color of these boots, they are very unique.
review.name: Very Comfortable and Stylish boots

name: Roxie Lane Mid Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Wonderful jacket! It keeps me warm with a base layer down to the upper 30s. So comfortable and soft too.
review.name: Luxurious and stylish

review.reviewBody: I like this jersey a lot. Being a Euro fit and I have a decidedly none euro bode the sleeves are a tad long but I love the color (blue, very bright-safe and stands out) and it's very comfortable. Have worn it down into the mid 40's with just a very thin shell over it and up into the high 60's. Once into the mid 60's it's a little warm but not a big deal, just drink and sweet a little more. The only reason for 4 stars is the Euro cut, otherwise a total 5 star product.
review.name: Nice and Toasty

review.reviewBody: Giordana makes great stuff. However, better order a size larger than you think because everything runs small. Also, Competitive Cyclist will charge you shipping when you return the item. In this situation it is $7.00 out the window so make sure you have the right size.
review.name: Giordana Silverline Thermal long sleeve

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite pairs!! Universal to wear anytime
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: I'm really happy with these sandals! They are so comfortable, cute color and I have gotten lots of compliments.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I love how you can easily adjust the straps throughout the day depending on the weather! Very bouncy and comfy bottom, but also supportive
review.name: Love these sandals!

review.reviewBody: I can always count on the sizing and comfort of the Mid Form. I love the color ways every year. I wear them from spring through the first snow. They look great with socks on.
review.name: I would buy them over and over

review.reviewBody: Just bought a new black Flatform to replace my old pair that I wore for 3 years. Love these comfortable, wear with almost anything, sandals! Don't stop making these sandals! Please make these in a solid color dark navy blue and a solid color dark brown. These would be spring, summer, and fall staples for me in those colors. I wear size 7 medium in sandals and these are true to size for me.
review.name: Love Flatform!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for walks and get complements on them. However, the foam sole is already tearing at the back strap after less than 6 months.
review.name: Comfy and cute, but falling apart

review.reviewBody: I got the platform tevas for the summmer. I wore once in a while. The sole is separating. Disappointing purchase.
review.name: Sole falling apart

review.reviewBody: I love the midform sandals so gave these platforms a try. Yes they are cute, but are in no way comfortable to walk in even for little random daily tasks. Could not believe how much my ankles and feet hurt after wearing these for just an hour. Sadly past the return window so a big waste of money for me.
review.name: Ouch

review.reviewBody: These sandals are so stylish and trendy plus platform is super comfy. Velcro straps allow for personalized comfort. I was able to wear all day walking on multiple terrains and I receive compliments every time I wear them. They actually go with everything!
review.name: Place in Cart and Buy!

review.reviewBody: Sorry to say they didn't work for me. I always loved platforms but as I have gotten older my left foot is swaying outwards and I can't find any shoes that work for me. I think they are great for others however. I am going to keep them because my granddaughter wear the same size.
review.name: My Teva sandals

name: Flatform Universal Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love this sports bra! It's very comfortable and soft. The merino wool does keep odors away! I'm usually a small or a medium but more often a medium so I ordered a medium in this but wish I would have gotten the small because it's a little less supportive than I would like but it's still really great. Hoping it might shrink a little bit when I wash it then it will be even more perfect.
review.name: Very high quality and comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
I'm a bigger busted lady, and deal with boob sweat constantly, not just while working out. This material is so light, breathable, and comfortable, it feels like I'm wearing nothing at all, but with the security of gentle support! The merino wool absorbs and evaporates my sweat without me feeling clammy or smelly, which is something I can't say for any of my "high performance, space age, synthetic, wicking material" bras. 

One downside - I have had better FITTING bras before. That's the price you pay when getting bras based on s/m/l/xl sizing rather than band and cup. I took out the removable cups, and that allowed a bit more give in the cup areas, so I'm not spilling out. Am I sad about the fit? No. I bought two from this website and turned around and bought two directly from Mons Royale because Backcountry was out of XL. 

tl;Dr - comfy bra, keeps me dry and comfy in all settings
review.name: So comfortable!

name: Sierra Sports Bra - Women's

review.reviewBody: 5 stars all day! Replaced a relatively new fusion manic dropper seat post with this KS lev CI. There is a dramatic difference in perceivable smoothness of operation and there is minimal to almost no perceivable side to side seat movement. Solid construction.  When I push the new Wolf Tooth southpaw lever it very quickly and smoothly drops. The "thunk" at the return to the top is also very confidence inspiring...others have said that and I whole heartedly agree. Its like knowing that the seat is in the right place without having to question it.  I haven't tried a fox transfer post, but I considered it simply for matching the kashima coat of my forks. If I had to do it again I would go for the 65mm option just to drop every gram possible...since rarely is dropping the full 125mm necessary.  I ride more XC to aggressive trails on my Niner Jet 9 X0 / 5 star build.
review.name: Super smooth and weight weenie light!

review.reviewBody: Had this thing on my S.C. tallboy for less than a month, and the lower bracket that sandwiches the seat was broken. Currently waiting on Backcountry to Warranty the Seat Post!
review.name: Broken Seat Bracket
comment: Did you get a warranty replacement? How is it otherwise?

name: LEV CI Carbon Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody:
I am a Birkenstock Devotee! And these did not disappoint in any way. It is however the 1st time I have purchased a pair with the blue footbeds.
The shoes are very well made and the suede is very soft to the touch, but firm enough not to be floppy. The blue footbeds feel different at first, but then mold to the exact shape of your foot in a few wearing’s. These shoes look sharp with just about anything I pair them with, khakis, Jeans, or casual pants. They also have a Moc -toe so they can be pulled off with utility pants as well. Overall another hit for Birkenstock! Get them fast because they are difficult to find anywhere. Hope my review helps you understand and make a purchasing decision.
Parker
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

hasVariant.name: Sureshot Pro Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Sureshot Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sureshot Pro Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Sureshot Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: There was something wrong with the way the lining was stitched, making it impossible to insert my right thumb into the glove! Others have mentioned the difficulty of lining up the fingers' interior lining with the fingers in the shell, but that's not what's going on here, it's clearly a manufacturing defect. I had expected better from OR. It sucks that I have to pay $6.99 to send back a defective product, you'd think Backcountry would offer free returns for defects.
review.name: Lemon

review.reviewBody: This glove is comfy and good for people who are going to ski.
review.name: Good gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves would be good if the lining was actually sewn to the glove better. Since it is not the lining slips independent of the outer shell removing any tactile capacity the gloves would have had and makes them difficult to get on since you have to align the lining fingers with the glove fingers. Very disappointed given how these are advertised and how good other non-lined gloves are that I have from OR
review.name: Not "sure shot" At All

review.reviewBody: Perfect gloves for winter in Brooklyn. Really pleased so far with the fit and warmth.
review.name: Great Pair of Gloves

review.reviewBody: The glove is thinner than I expected but still surprisingly warm and durable. I bought them for my morning runs and workouts but now I wear them all the time. I lift weights with them and they show no signs of wear yet. I just wish they were a little warmer.
review.name: Surprisingly durable and warm

review.reviewBody: The initial fit is good, and it seems like a good product in general. Unfortunately, if you take your glove off and try to put it back on the lining isn't attached to the outer well and it pulls out. Putting the glove back on becomes a pain. Not great for me.
review.name: Lining Bunches Up - Bad for frequent on/off/on scenarios

review.reviewBody: Really like the warmth and comfort, but the flexibility was surprising for the warmth. Easy to pull on with the straps and the velcro cuff is great for adjusting the fit over or under jackets.
review.name: Very warm, but not bulky!

review.reviewBody: Went camping and was expecting it to be snowing but it wasn't. There was snow on the ground and it was pouring down rain, I was worried that with these gloves my hands would just get wet and cold cus it was actual rain not snow. Boy was I wrong, my hands stayed so dang dry I am thoroughly impressed! And even when it got dark the weather dropped to around 25 and these kept my hands warm and they weren't too bulky, I was able to start a fire, do some shooting drills (AR and pistol) as well as some other bushcraft activities with ease. LOVE these gloves, great purchase!
review.name: SO WARM AND WATERPROOF

review.reviewBody: Dexterity. Warmth. Great cuff. For the price, it's second to none.
review.name: Exceptional

review.reviewBody: I've used these gloves primarily for cooler weather cycling conditions now approaching in the northeast. They're also with me for exposed ridge lines on my mountain adventures. They really block the wind nicely and they also provide good dexterity. I've been a big proponent of OR gear over the past few decades, and these Sureshot Pros are a nice addition to the mix. Picking them up on a sale was extra sweet. The only reason I held off on the fifth star is that they're a slightly tighter fit than the Flurry Sensors which have been my go-to for a wide range of activities.
review.name: Another Great OR Product

name: Sureshot Pro Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered a dark red Pace jacket a month ago on sale, and I am pleased with it. Much too warm outside now to try it out in chilly weather to see how warm it is, but the outer fabric is substantial and has enough insulation that I think it will be warm without layers into the low 40s. I also really like the dark red color with the contrasting zipper colors. So much more flattering than dull black or dark blue! 
That said the Pace jacket does not have a 2 way zipper and it is much heavier than 1.1 
lbs. Sizing runs a bit large, as another reviewer noted. I bought a size small , my usual size and there is more room than usual to add a warm fleece underneath. All-in-all a nice quality waterproof and comfortable fall/late fall jacket.
review.name: My new favorite mid-late fall jacket

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and warm!
I got this as a winter rain jacket and it works pretty good.
I can stay dry and warm.
I got yellow and love color too!
review.name: Love this!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this jacket bc I needed a new ski jacket and found this one on sale. WOW! What a find! It runs a tiny bit big enough to layer comfortably but not enough to be bulky. So far I have worn it in the snow, sleet and gentle rain and it has performed great. I skiied on a frigid day here in the north east and didnt need to use my heated vest. The fabric is soft, when I put the hood up and zipped it all the way up, it did not chafe my chin.  I had no issues fitting the hood over my helmet. And the pockets!!! So many pockets and they are so deep, I didnt worry about stuff falling out when I unzipped them. The color is amazing and better than it looked online. All around amazing find. Its my first Marmot item and it wont be my last.
review.name: Amazing Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really wanted to love this jacket, but the fit wasn't there for me. I ordered the port royal color and really liked it, but wanted something a little more fun and ultimately returned it. I ordered a large, but it was way too big on me. I would recommend sizing down. I have a 38C bust, 33" waist, 41" hip, 168 lbs. and 5'4". It was very warm and will be a great winter jacket for anyone. I'm not a fan of the green color, but may look better in person. I still recommend this product!!
review.name: Great jacket!

name: Pace Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Distance 1500 Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Distance 1500 Headlamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Distance 1500 Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This headlamp is very bright and lasted for a long time and allowed me to do technical trail runs at night
review.name: fantastic headlamp

review.reviewBody: Purchased for SAR work in my area. I carry a spare battery and have never needed it during a single mission. Super bright when needed and great battery length.
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: So far it is all that it promised to be. Bright, easy to use, and not very bulky. It is comfortable and stays in place. I haven’t had a chance to really test the battery life yet but I’m sure it’s more than adequate. My only complaint is the pictures only instruction manual was hard for me to understand. I’m still not sure I know how to control it well. An instructional video would go a long way I think.
review.name: Very nice headlamp

review.reviewBody: As the title says, this is a great, high quality and solid lamp. Work as advertised
review.name: Great unit

review.reviewBody: I used this headlamp for a Rim 2 Rim, night crossing of Grand Canyon and it performed extremely well. I used it on its 800 lumen setting the entire time which allowed me to move faster than I would have with a regular headlamp. The 1500 lumen bump for ten seconds was also great for route finding. I had purchased this over legitimate SAR headlamps that were brighter because I felt it was the best performance to weight ratio and its ease of changing batteries on the move, which I did. I really appreciated that it went into power saving mode when the battery was low, that's how I knew it was time to change batteries. Works great for its intended purpose, 10 out of 10.
review.name: Distance 1500

review.reviewBody: I have been using this light daily since it arrived. Is is amazing how much light it produces. I love the wide angle of the light so less of the tunnel vision of some other lights. There are many options for setting lighting levels, color of light. The instructions are easy to understand. It will take a bit for me to internalize them, but the major settings I use most of the time are readily available. The headband is very comfortable and fits solidly on my big head. I like the balance of the low-profile battery pack on my back of my head with the low profile lighting on the front. The interchangeable battery packs is a neat feature. I can see they can swap out very easily compared to fumbling with sorting batteries. Like all other headlamps I have used, the small buttons will be a challenge with gloves, but haven't had to try that yet. I think once I have it on, I won't be messing with it, so I expect this to be a minor problem. Overall, a great headlamp that provides amazing performance in a lightweight comfortable package.
review.name: Powerful, versatile and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Bright headlamp with easy to change battery pack. Fits well & securely for trail runs.
review.name: bright, quick change battery pack

review.reviewBody: Incredible headlamp! Signed up for my 100 mile ultra and did not want to worry about my lighting through the night. This was very comfortable and I had plenty of light!
review.name: Distance 1500

review.reviewBody: I got this headlamp for SAR to use on the long searches and pack-outs at night. So far, this headlamp has performed well but there are a couple of things that I would prefer were changed. The biggest thing is that whenever you turn the white light on, it comes on in the same default setting, instead of the last setting you had it on. When I customize the settings for a specific purpose, I would like it to come back on on the same setting when I turn it back on. One example is when I need some real distance illumination, I flip it on to the spot light and maybe adjust the brightness. I then need to turn it off to talk to team mates to coordinate or read a map. When I turn it back on, it comes on in the default flood setting and I need to adjust everything again. Overall the flood setting is great for navigating trails.
review.name: I got this headlamp for

review.reviewBody: Best rechargeable head lamp. Rugged, non fussy, reasonable burn time while awaiting sunrise. Replacing battery with big gloves can be done without risking frostbite.
review.name: Best rechargeable head lamp. Rugged,

name: Distance 1500 Headlamp

review.reviewBody: I have not ridden in them yet.  But, first impression is great especially the fit.  If you're like me and always at risk for heel slippage, these fit securely in the heel!  Go up one full size from what the chart says.  My feet measure 266mm so Northwave says size 42.  I bought 43 and they're perfect.  I can't give 5 stars at this time because first impression also looks like the cleat position is fairly forward from the ball of my foot, might not be a big deal.  Will know for sure once I setup cleats, but may just keep these as backup shoes as I'm still waiting for some other shoes I ordered to arrive before deciding what will be my primary shoes.  These shoes are underrated I believe.  At the sale price, you can't go wrong!
review.name: Excellent fit

name: Mistral Cycling Shoe - Men's

Pair well with my flats sneakers and keeps the sand out
review.name: Guide socks

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable wading boot socks for either saltwater or freshwater fishing.  They keep sand and gravel out of the wading boots as advertised.  They complement the wading perfectly.
review.name: Great addition to the wading boots

review.reviewBody:
The best wading socks ever made 
Very comfortable and fit perfect!!

Please make the old style again (without the perforations). I wear wading socks for work in the late summer and early autumn in trout/salmon waters. The water is cold (~10C) but the air temps are too warm for waders. My feet get way too cold in these. I had to go back to wearing the old style and they are falling apart with no option for replacement.
review.name: No perforations, please!

review.reviewBody: Ripped after 1st use. Super disappointed as Simms is normally great. Wouldn’t recommend
review.name: Ripped after 1st use

review.reviewBody: Bad on me that I made an assumption the   neoprene sock would be waterproof, it is not.  It’s intended to be a gravel guard only. Well made for what it designed for.  Just not at all what I expected or wanted.   Purchased a pair for myself and my wife.
review.name: Surprised not waterproof

review.reviewBody:
I had the older version of these and they were great.  I wanted to upgrade to the new version to get the benefit of the draining material, so my feet wouldn't turn into soup on long days.  
Mine tore along the seams on the 2nd day of use.  So I'm pretty disappointed.  I have size 12 feet and the XL's feel way too small. 
One other thing I noticed was that your feet get colder as there is flow of water due to the holes.  Not a big deal, but something to be aware of.
review.name: Poor Quality, poor fit

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm, easy to get on and off and they dry easier than previous models. A must for hot summer air temps and colder tail water temps.
review.name: Do it, you’ll be happy ya did!

review.reviewBody: The socks are great, but the seams fell apart after 2 weeks of use.

name: Guide Guard Sock

comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I love Chacos because they fix my plantar fascitis

review.reviewBody: The straps keep slipping through the sole. The part that goes over the toes keeps getting tight while the ankle gets loose. comment: We appreciate your feedback. We recommend tossing your sandals in your washing machine on a gentle cycle using a mild detergent and cold/warm water. Then allow them to air dry. review.reviewBody: The adjustable straps have made all the difference and the sandal gives my feet the needed support. I wish all the sandals/slides were that adjustable.

review.reviewBody: I have the earlier ShakeDry version of this cap. The fabric, as always, is brilliant. But my cap is cut exceptionally small. It really only fits on a bare head, and even then wants to pull up and off all the time. It's nearly impossible to use in winter with even a very thin skullcap underneath. Plus it's very short, so if your hair is longer than "marine buzz cut" the bottom of your hair will get soaked, then wick up and soak the rest of your head.  I don't think the designers ever rode in the rain with this one!
review.name: Try before you buy

review.reviewBody: Not as tight-fitting as some of the other cycle caps that I have, but it's not too bulky and fits fine under a standard helmet. Kept my head dry in the rain and I didn't overheat even when the rain stopped. Lightweight, easy to stash in a jersey pocket or handlebar bag when it's not needed.
review.name: Works well, fits fine

name: C7 GORE-TEX Cap

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the jacket. true to size and stretches a bit. Very good quality.
review.name: Great jacket, thin but warm

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First off, your satisfaction with any article of clothing depends entirely on your expectations; this jacket is no different. 

If you're expecting anything closely resembling an R1, you'll be terribly disappointed. It's not soft, comfy, warm, or an athletic fit. Expect it to be a full size larger than an R1. 

If you're expecting a wind- and water-resistant technical layer, that FEELS like one, you may love this jacket. This most closely resembles a softshell with a hint of a fleecy backing, and has a traditional boxy fit. I'm 5'8" with a 42" chest, and wear my Men's M R1 as a baselayer for Temps around 0 and below. It's form-fitting and tight and I can't really fit anything underneath it. This in a Medium fits comfortably, with room for 1-2 layers underneath it. It's also not warm, but it's not supposed to be; it's meant to cut wind and light precip and that's it. But it's also not particularly soft or comfortable, about as soft as a burly softshell, not a soft and comfy softshell.

The biggest issue is the naming and marketing. They call it the "R1 TechFace" to capitalize on the success of the R1 and R-series name, but this isn't really an R1 at all. They should call it something different, like the T1 TechFace, or the TF1 to indicate it's not an R1. 

The only other problem, as a couple other reviewers have mentioned, is the collar. It's pretty stiff and rigid and stands up right in front of your chin and jaw, occassionally rubbing. Zipped up, it doesn't quite fit comfortably anywhere. Goes back to the "burly softshell" comment: burly softshells aren't soft. 

Otherwise, this jacket is great. Love it. Great under-helmet hood. Great boxy roomy fit. Only thing(s) it's missing is a chest pocket and thumbholes. Both of which my R1 has and I wish this had. I may return this and hope they add these features to future generations. 

I subtracted stars for mis-labeling this as an R1, stiff and less-than-comfortable fabric, and missing chest pockets and thumbholes.
review.name: Great burly tough softshell, Not an R1

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is now a staple in my touring laying system. It breaths incredibly well and offers great protection from wind and precipitation. It fits well and is slim fitting enough that a warmer puffy will fit over top without issue. Highly recommend this jacket!
review.name: Most versatile

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my favorite touring layer! I was a bit apprehensive on how lightweight and breathable this jacket is based off the pictures but can confirm this as thin as it needs to be. One thing that surprised me was it does keep the chill away just enough when starting a tour or taking a break.
review.name: Breathable

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I have had mine for just over a year; I initially purchased it to be my primary shell for backcountry skiing but have ended up also using it countless times for winter hiking, mountaineering, mountain biking, running, and even as my shell for spring time resort skiing. I've brushed up against countless trees and even taken a slide down a slope that ripped the two layers I was wearing under this jacket to pieces and it escaped unharmed. It is very breathable, warm when active, decently windproof, and repels moderate amounts of drier snow. I did take it out in a Seattle rainstorm to see how it would do and it wet out after about 20 minutes but has never wet out on me in snow or light drizzles.  It is also surprisingly packable. My only critiques are I sometimes wish it had a slightly longer hem for the snow and pockets that could fit climbing skins, though this would be less ideal for its other uses. Going forward I plan to transition this piece for use for non-skiing fall/winter/spring activities and purchase a more ski specific soft shell for touring, though I am very picky. Honestly I cannot recommend this piece enough for any outdoor enthusiast looking for a multi-sport, year round piece.
review.name: Breathable, versatile, and durable

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I took this jacket on my most recent trip to Southern Utah. I was canyoneering through slot canyons. Squeezing through rocks. Scraping my arms and back on the walls. I thought for sure I would have damaged the jacket, but when I got home...and took it off. It was still in mint condition. I'm very impressed!
review.name: I love this jacket.

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I run very warm while hiking. This is great as a cold weather light mid layer or as a stand alone for 25-35 F weather.  

Breathes pretty well and seems very durable. Haven?t used it in rainy conditions. 

I can see myself bringing this along for summer as well

Fit for me is perfect. Purchased Large.  6? 200lbs
review.name: Versatile

review.itemreviewed: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice athletic fit like most of Patagonia's stuff. I'm 5'10''/175lbs and got the medium. Great for climbing, hood fits well over helmet and will cinch down tight without helmet. No thumb holes like the other R1 hoodie but the cuffs do fit well and don't get in the way for climbing or other activities, they aren't loose or too long. I was hoping with the TechFace finish it would be more wind resistant but it's still a little breezy. Only slightly better than a standard R1 hoodie for wind but it isn't the same weight. It's slightly lighter than the standard R1 and doesn't seem as warm to me but the full zipper design is much better. I like the jacket for the not so cold days but for colder days I think I will get an R2 Tech Face jacket since my original R1 seems warmer.
review.name: Great base layer or light jacket

name: R1 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I had the original raven, I mtb several days out of the week and unfortunately my reservoir did not hold up very well, the bite guard ripped and the clip at the top broke. I prefer camelbacks reservoir a bit more. Also the little side pocket got snagged on a branch and ripped only a few months in. Aside from that I prefer the pack to CamelBak. It’s super comfortable and breathable. I just wish they’d update their water reservoir, it’s definitely a pain in the butt to fill. Hopefully I can try the updated raven pack soon.
review.name: Raven

name: Raven 14L Hydration Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Montana Ski Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I burnt a hole in the first pair messing with a camp fire. So that was my fault! Def wanted to stay with these gloves as my replacements. Great value for price - I bought them 20%off retail price. I use them for 2+ hours snow blowing, playing in the snow with the dog, cleaning off the car and shoveling and skiing above 10 degrees F. I love that they can snap together so when I take them off or store them, they are easy to find as a pair- and way less likely to misplace or lose one. Also love the ability to tighten them down at the wrist with the strap so less snow gets in and they don't slide off. Good strong outer fabric that is wear resistant but still allows easy mobility. Good water resistance.
review.name: Bought my second pair!

review.reviewBody: The warmest gloves I've ever owned. These are great for skiing since I have some control over my hands still.
review.name: Great for skiing

name: Montana Ski Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit nicely. I’m 65 and it covered my stomach completely. It’s very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great tankini. It's well made and better yet, very flattering. I love all three Carve tankinis I own.
review.name: This is a great tankini.

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite tankini top I have ever bought. This is my third one. I wear it with carve design board shorts. It fit perfect and does not come off when wake surfing.

review.reviewBody: This is a cute tanikini - I like the cut and style and the material seems nice. The underwires flare out just a bit causing a bit of a gap near the armpit. I'll keep it though and definitely wear it.
review.name: Weird underwire

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fabric and design, it just didn't quite fit me well around the chest. I'm sure it would look great on some people

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quality product, just didn't look the best on me. Also, didn't like the bra underwire, seems to pull down on the favorite and it isn't necessary to the design of the suit.
review.name: Underwire makes it lay odd.

review.reviewBody: This is so comfortable! Adjustable straps make it fit like a glove and offer support. It will be great for paddle boarding.
review.name: This is so comfortable! Adjustable

review.reviewBody: I love the quality and fit, but most of all, I love how it ties in the back, because it can be tightened for the perfect fit and does not dig into the back of your neck like suits that tie behind your neck. The way it ties is also super cute. I also like how the ties on the side can be adjusted depending on the look you are going for or the bottoms you are wearing. The top is also form fitting without being tight. I will absolutely order it again in another color.
review.name: Flattering!

review.reviewBody: Women who need all around support (DD) would so appreciate a top without the back cut out. This top would be perfect if it wasn't for that. Sadly have to return it.
review.name: Top would be great for larger busts without the back cutout

review.reviewBody:
Cup size is way too small
And on the larger size near armpit so it doesn’t lay nice

review.reviewBody: This is a lovely silky shirt. The fabric is delicate though, so just be careful around Velcro or other things that could snag it.
review.name: Great for layering or wearing on its own

review.reviewBody: this is a super lightweight tee, great for running, hiking, and even just daily wear. super breathable and great colors. It hasn't let me down. It is durable and easily washable. I have used it for just about everything. It is always the shirt I reach for first. I will for sure be buying more and I would highly recommend it.
review.name: great shirt

review.reviewBody: My go to shirt for hot wx for hiking, running, and soccer. Its wicking and breathability is unmatched. Feels cooler than wearing no shirt at all.  Downsides: no stretch, tends to run a little tight and questionable durability. The hem at the bottom of the shirt started to unravel after only about 3 washes. Also gets pulls very easily. Would not hike with it in any brushy conditions. But performance unmatched.
review.name: Excellent breathability, questionable durability

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit, stands alone or great base layer. Great color
review.name: Great base layer

review.reviewBody: Very light fabric. Looks great and feels great.  Fits perfectly.
review.name: Echo tee

review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt, it has grown on me.  The shirt is so lightweight its like I am wearing nothing and it dries super fast. In the right light you can see right through this shirt (Monstera color), that's a little strange.
review.name: Sweet Sweet Sweet

review.reviewBody: Light yet strong. Great fit, allows for free movements. The white color is a bit see-through though.
review.name: Super good

review.reviewBody: I own several Echo shirts in short and long sleeve. I also have several other synthetic shirts. I wore these on a punishing AT hike. The Echo is my favorite. No other shirt comes close in hot weather. It's as close to not wearing a shirt as you can get without taking it off. It wicks sweat away, drips it off, and dries fast. While most synthetics snag and tear in sticks and thorns, the Echo didn't. It's much more durable than it looks and feels. The only wear mine shows is the seams where trekking pole and pack straps rub. It's a slim fit, so size up for a loose fit.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: Lightest weight t shirt I can find. Great for hot days running trails in the canyons.
review.name: Great hot weather shirt

review.reviewBody: The perfect shirt for hot days while still looking "premium". It's slightly textured and fits great for running or mountainbiking.
review.name: Light and athletic fit

name: Echo T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: They fit well and I appreciate that the sole can be removed. The bottom traction is a bit soft so it has broken down faster than I had hoped. I'd still buy again as it is a solid shoe that can handle running, jumping, biking, adventuring of a toddler. My child is age 3 in a size 7.
review.name: I'd buy again

review.reviewBody: Sturdy shoe that seems comfortable. My toddler requests this shoe over the others. The felt material on the sole has frayed, but its to be expected and the shoe works just as it did before. The shoe is easy to clean, which is nice because the colors are the main reason I bought the shoe.
review.name: Sturdy, colorful, comfortable

review.reviewBody: When I had Kelly try on these shoes, he was so excited to have shoes that have a rainbow on them!  He switches back and forth between this pair and the other pair I ordered for him.  He enjoys wearing them and they fit very well!
review.name: Kelly Approved
comment: Thank you for your great review!

review.reviewBody: I bought the rainbow shoe 5 days ago for my 2 yo granddaughter. After wearing these shoes twice to daycare the black bottom tread is shredding off.  Using this site to correct the problem is not working.  I can’t seem to load pictures either.
review.name: Falling apart after two days of indoor play.
comment: We're extremely sorry to hear this and would love the opportunity to make it right. Please call 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com to speak with a live representative so we can assist you.

review.reviewBody: Too narrow even though labeled as wide. It did not fit my toddler any different than a regular shoe, so I had to return to buy a different wide shoe.
review.name: Too narrow
comment: We're sorry to hear these did not work out for you.

review.reviewBody: The kid loves them, fancy footwear for the four year old
review.name: Fancy footwear for the four year old
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
My 6 year old starting wearing these on September 6. It has not even been two months of wear and they look like this on the soles. Absolutely terrible quality. I am a loyal Merrell wearer and want my kids to wear good shoes too. I trust Merrell for quality, durability, and support. But this quality is embarrassing. This is the heart of the sustainability crisis - a product that is essentially disposable, that does not even last for the length of it's intended use. 

Merrell should have tested this shoe against their mission: "Our goal is to provide thoughtfully designed, rigorously tested products that over-deliver on performance, versatility, and durability."
review.name: Abysmal quality!

review.reviewBody: Love my Shoes! Every Adventure I take, my Merrells are sure to go! 😊Dont leave home without them. 5 stars & Two Thumbs up👍
review.name: Love my Merrells
comment: Thank you for the amazing review!

name: Nova 3 Sneaker - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: I like this hat; it’s light weight and handy that it can be folded down and put in a bag. My only issue with it is that it does not pull very tight with the binge because the  fabric around the crown does not compress. If there were a gap in the back then it could be pulled tighter and stay on better in windy conditions.
review.name: Good design, but not easily adjustable

review.reviewBody: Love it! Great blue-gray color and perfect for traveling
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Like another reviewer here stated, the large in gray (mineral) is a good size too small. I've owned several other SunAft hats in large and even L/M and they were all larger than the "L" gray I received. It's too small for my head.
review.name: Great IF you don't mind it being too small

review.reviewBody: I ordered a second cap so that I have some variety.  They wear well and are easy to clean.
review.name: Another great cap

review.reviewBody: Have had lots of compliments on hat. I like the comfort of this hat and I wear all day.
The sun tripper is my go-to hat style ( I have a lot of them), but please consider adding some fun colors (bright pink, aqua, multicolor)!
review.name: Foldable brim a game-changer!

review.reviewBody: Perfect compact hat for paddleboarding,  hiking, and more!
review.name: Perfect lil cap

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. Have a tendency to get skin cancer so always have at least one in the car to protect my face when I am unexpectedly caught outside. Fits great & can be cinched tight if heavy winds blow at the beach, which is frequent.  Washes up easily & doesn’t get bent out of shape when crammed in a suitcase.  I’ve had my rust colored one for at least 5 years & have taken it everywhere.  Shows no signs of wear.  Even my fashionista DIL from DC borrowed the blue one this morning to weir to Michigan Adventure!  Note I have a big head so I get L in this style.
review.name: Great cap!

review.reviewBody: This is a great cap with all the features and designs
review.name: Wonder Cap!

review.reviewBody: I love my SunTripper Cap, no kidding ? It is so well made. And I love how it brim folds in half to stuff in my … whatever. Comfortable and cute looking ! Who could ask for more?
review.name: My gold suntripper

name: Sun Tripper Cap

review.reviewBody: Very good product. Works as advertised. I'd be ecstatically enthusiastic if you told me it was made from recycled plastics. Easy order and flawless delivery.

review.reviewBody: The Climbing Riser Block is a vast improvement over the block that came with my smart trainer. It is substantially for stable than my previous block.

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I needed and helps stabilize the front wheel

review.reviewBody: I bought this with my fluid 2 trainer and training mat.  It feels so much better riding with the bike level

review.reviewBody: I bought this with the Saris manual trainer to use my bike inside and love both of them!

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the SARIS Climbing Riser Block and I am very happy with it. It keeps my bike sturdy and in place while I spin. If you are contemplating getting it, you SHOULD! You can adjust the block (simply by turning it) and it will raise or lower the height of your bike.
review.name: Great Option For A Sturdy & Safe Spin!
