review.reviewBody: This is so perfect for someone who bikes to work regularly, great for attaching high vis, lights etc. also perfect side for someone who has a shorter torso like me. Just wish it came in different colours (navy, nude pink, sage green).
review.name: Perfect for me

review.reviewBody: Very cool and fun that the Talon Earth 22 (fitted for men) fits a hydration pack OR a laptop, yet the version built for women has such a tiny hydration sleeve that if other reviews are to be believed you can’t even get a hydration pack in there? Women need supportive packs for laptops too you know, at least until the fascists take our jobs away…
review.name: Why does the men’s fit a laptop but not the women’s? SMH

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just got the opportunity to use my pack yesterday. Had no idea how difficult getting a water bladder into the hydration pocket would be! Yikes ... That would have been a deal breaker had I known. I live in AZ and water pocket is the most critical part.
review.name: I just got the opportunity

review.reviewBody: Excellent. Comfortable. Great distribution of weight. Walked a long distance and hardly felt it.
review.name: Excellent. Comfortable. Great distribution of

review.reviewBody: It’s a decent enough backpack, but it’s 30% heavier than the previous version, the non-scratch material in the top and internal pockets is gone, the back is a bit too stiff for me and the stretch pocket on the strap still doesn’t fit many modern sized phones (e.g. s21) and also comes with a button closure and some wire which I’m not sure of purpose. I’d rather have had another one of the old version I bought in 2016.
review.name: The old version was better

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the waist belt on this pack, really stays up on my hips and doesn't slip. The large compartment for your stuff is spacious, but if you're not carrying much you can still cinch it down. Sits comfortably on my shoulders and has several places to adjust for the most comfortable fit.
review.name: I love the waist belt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable but the only thing is the water bladder slot is really tight. Is hard to get a hydration pack in there.
review.name: Very comfortable but the only

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great size, very comfortable. Huge fan of the waist belt!
review.name: Great size, very comfortable. Huge

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, comfortable, does everything I need it to
review.name: Great fit, comfortable, does everything

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this pack — comfortable and really just the right size. I wouldn’t mind another inside pocket or two for organization purposes, but even without that, I’d buy this versatile, right-sized pack again. I’ve traveled all over the UK, Greece and Turkey with it.
review.name: Love this pack — comfortable

hasVariant.name: Standard Issue 8x25 Waterproof Binocular
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nocs Provisions Standard Issue 8x25 Waterproof Binocular online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of binoculars and these fit my needs perfectly. I love the compact size, fits my smallish average hands very well and love the durable outer coating. Used on a safari and hiking in Rwanda and these were comfortable on my neck. Optics were very clear and easy to adjust focus with my hand while holding. So happy with these. I was able to take a few pictures with my iPhone 14 Pro through the binoculars and it was definitely tricky to focus.
review.name: Love!!!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to throw in a backpack for hikes in Southern Utah as we scout the cliffs.  They are the perfect size and offer a clear picture and ideal magnification power for my purposes.  They are sturdy and easy to use for me and the kids.  I definitely recommend these for a solid set of hiking binoculars.
review.name: Perfect hiking binoculars
comment: Landon, Thanks so much for your review on these binoculars! It looks like you found the perfect pair for you and your family!
Landon, Thanks so much for your review on these binoculars! It looks like you found the perfect pair for you and your family!

review.reviewBody: Bought these binoculars in particular because of the advertised feature of being able to easily use them to shoot photos using your smartphone camera - this is misleading.  The binoculars are great for normal use & I like their design and how packable they are, but with current smartphones having multiple lenses, it's nearly impossible to get a picture using the bino's.  If the phone pic feature is something that you're particularly drawn to, I'd suggest looking elsewhere, but if you're looking for a cool pair of small, packable binoculars, these a solid choice!
review.name: Good, but slightly misleading

name: Standard Issue 8x25 Waterproof Binocular

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Definitely soft, warm and comfortable. They seem wide looking but are no wider than other winter boots I have. I can't get them on without a shoe horn, though. They need, need a leather pull tab in back. Once on, they're great.
review.name: Great feel and fit, but kind of wide and needs a pull on tab in back

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The most comfortable shoe I have ever worn besides a coy boy boots. I purchased 2 pairs for my siblings, and 2 back up pairs for my self! That's how much I love them! I really Like the Blk n White! now I want a blk on blk! I think a natural leather color with no die. would be fresh. there so comfortable when your foot slides in. The blk are more for hiking and biking and always Striding, definitely keeps the h2o out. the other fabric not as much . That's ok just weather proof them! they're still best kicks on the market for the price and quality. i didnt think they would last! Please dont take them off ever! just uprgade them with zippers in the middle/buckles or whatever you want in the coming years! if you use my idea let me try them out! Top Notch!
Mr.Grimes
review.name: SO COMFY AND STYLISH!

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these to walk my dog. Boots didn’t last a year. I walk only in the park on the sidewalk. Not sure whether a wood stick could damage the shoe or it is just a poor quality.
review.name: Soaked feet after first year

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these 6 months ago and can’t express how much I love the visual aesthetic of these boots, but unfortunately they do not stand up to practical use. Waterproof ability  deteriorated very quickly at crease points on the right boot which now makes them both obsolete. So sad because they look so great. If you don’t need waterproof capabilities, they work great for insulation and look pretty sweet.
review.name: Would not purchase again

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: While I enjoy the general comfort and style, the seal broke on the right toe after two weeks of wearing (not excessive use: walking the dog on snowy sidewalks). Literally stopped doing the one job it’s supposed to do, and the timing could not have been worse given the recent blizzard.
review.name: No longer waterproof after two weeks

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this item for the features...100% waterproof, hybrid styling...but what I got was the most comfortable pair of shoes/boots I have ever bought!  Got these to walk the dog here in the Pacific NW...best purchase ever!
review.name: Cool and comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The rugged gentleman look! Great for outdoors and date night. He adores how they feel. He says that his feet feel like there are fluffy soft pillows on his feet that keep him warm. He has super wide feet and these fit him perfectly!
review.name: Husband loves it!

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Boot are awsome.   Thet wear well and are very comfortable.   Great styling without being over constructed.  
BUT
Really @kip001 .... DO you really have to be wearing your pink hat to even write a shoe review ?  Most fashion items are gender specific,  it even said so in the description. Please save it for your next woman's rally,  this is not the place.
review.name: Seriously... equal ?

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Awesome boots! They fit perfectly and are very comfortable. The microfleece lining is superb.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro Hi WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Returned without wearing as they run at least 1/2 size large. Construction appeared good and they were comfortable apart from sizing.
review.name: Runs large

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Alpha Ultimate Insulated Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've not used this, but have tried it on. A detail about these alpha jackets that is usually not provided is how the sleeves are insulated. Often, the inner half of the sleeve is left uninsulated. I prefer complete coverage. This jacket mostly does the latter, insulating the complete upper sleeve but uniquely leaving the forearms uninsulated. 

A close comparison is the Sportful Total Comfort jacket, which also has a Polartec shell, but the Alpha insulation provides complete coverage of the arms all the way down. The Castelli jacket has seam sealing and double cuffs, so it is made with foul weather in mind. But the Sportful jacket is much less expensive, and looks and feels well totally comfortable (I own this one).
review.name: Some added detail

name: Alpha Ultimate Insulated Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: X-alp Launch SPD Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have wide feet and a high talus and finding the right MTB shoe for longer days is complicated. These shoes are real comfortable and provide good enough support for effective pedaling. They are so comfortable in fact, that I don’t need to take other shoes with me for after the ride. The clear does need to be installed at an odd angle, if I install it straight (like I’ve always done on all other cycling shoes I’ve owned) my feet will be angled inwards on the pedals. This feels strange. And I had to trim a little of the outsole around the cleats so I could clip/unclip easier.
review.name: Really comfy!

review.itemreviewed: X-alp Launch SPD Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the first clipless experience for me.  The shoes are comfortable and the clipless system is working perfectly for me.   Sorry for the short review, but I was initially hesitant ordering these becasue there weren't any reviews.  Great shoe.
review.name: Working Great

name: X-alp Launch SPD Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: K-Pact Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the ION K-Pact Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: K-Pact Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the ION K-Pact Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have fairly muscular thighs, so I had to order a large in order to make them fit. 
However,  after a few uses they have stretched quite a bit around the thigh and are now way too big in that area, and now I am stuck with pads that don't fit right. 


UPDATE: 

Downsized to a size MEDIUM, and now they are absolutely amazing. 
Super comfortable, even after hours of pedaling. 
The protection is great, especially the side padding, and has saved my knees/ shins on several occasions.
review.name: Awkward Fit  -> Down-Sized, Now Awesome

review.reviewBody: I got these for my girlfriend. We measured according to the chart and got a small, but she thought they were too tight. Exchanged for a medium and she says they are perfect. They stay put and are comfortable. She hasn?t taken any falls with them but they seem like a very good product that offers a lot of protection, and she doesn?t even really notice that they are on when riding.
review.name: Comfortable knee pads

review.reviewBody: Fell on a >30 degree slope downhill when doing about 20+ mph. Landed/slided on my left and ION did a perfect job keeping my knees from the sharp loose gravels. Fibers not torn. The guard didn’t move around either. Breathable and protective. Worth my money!
review.name: Tested! Saved my knee!

name: K-Pact Knee Pad
